item.title: Report X-2024071889
item.description:
Report X-2024071889

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: PALMDALE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered on the belt leaking a white powder. Inspection found the contents leaking from within due to the inner containers bursting open and leaking out powder. Possibly dropped. Package was observed to be placed on its side despite the orientation arrows. Improper inner packaging to keep the contents secured and improper handling of package.

item.title: Report X-2024071682
item.description:
Report X-2024071682

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came out of trailer 831338 in a wet state. Package was placed in a tote for QA inspection. upon analysis, contents are 2 cans of Lube-lok 5396 diluted with 1 can being dented, causing its lid to open and cause its liquid content to spill. Better inner packing would prevent dents that would cause lids to pop open.

item.title: Report E-2024070592
item.description:
Report E-2024070592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: CERES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 15, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of NA1993 were crushed in transit and released approximately forty (40) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (ACS) to remediate the impacted site. ACS personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071390
item.description:
Report X-2024071390

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came out of trailer 825967 in a wet leaking state, which was placed in a tote and QA inspection was done. Finding was 4 bottles of Concentrated lime and rust remover bottles with 1 bottle have a loose cap from abrasion on movement, which lead its liquid content to spill out of the bottle. Better packing to prevent caps from abrasion would have help prevent the loose cap and spill.

item.title: Report I-2024070086

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This package was intercepted based on an incident with a similar package from this shipper. The unmarked, non-specification package contained a 6000Wh battery with terminals unprotected. No marks on the battery. No declaration of dangerous goods. No indication of testing.

item.title: Report X-2024071383
item.description:
Report X-2024071383

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When the shipment was discovered and inspected, the leak source was from loosened caps on the two dented bottles of Zep #R45802, concentrated industrial purple degreaser. There was no inner barrier to attenuate the extent of the leakage , and no cushioning evident to protect the inner containers from outside forces applied to them during the transportation process .

item.title: Report I-2024060047
item.description:
Report I-2024060047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Halfway through the flight, passenger 20A, told FA Pang that their laptop was emitting an electrical smell. FA conferred with FM and both agreed there was a smell. No flames, heat, or smoke were present. Out of an abundance of caution, the MacBook Pro was placed into the TCB. The TCB was placed in an aft lav and monitored occasionally per CA instructions occasionally throughout the flight. The TCB remained in the aft lav until descent, in which it was brought to the forward lav for easy access upon door opening. Due to no signs of fire, smoke, or heat, pax was escorted to the exit and was able to retrieve the laptop out of the TCB. FAs reminded to fill out IORs and thanked for erring on the side of caution.
